definition: according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before

sentences.english: Flowers in the spring sunshine are much more beautiful than ever.
sentences.chinese: 春日照耀下的花朵分外的妖嬈。

sentences.english: The tall Gothic windows glinted in the sinking sun.
sentences.chinese: 高大的哥特式窗戶在夕陽的照耀下閃閃發光。

sentences.english: What place someone at the bright moon shining on the upper floors Acacia?
sentences.chinese: 什麼地方有人在明月照耀的樓上相思？

sentences.english: Then June came , Sun shine , are we still nowhere ?
sentences.chinese: 夏來，日光照耀，一切還是無法結束嗎？

sentences.english: Under the morning sun, a great happiness hovers in space.
sentences.chinese: 在晨日的照耀下，一股巨大的歡喜之情在空中翱翔。

sentences.english: The sun that shone on the British empire had passed midday.
sentences.chinese: 照耀大英帝國的太陽已過晌午。

sentences.english: Stars shine brightest in the long dark night of winter.
sentences.chinese: 星光照耀得最亮的時候，是在黑暗的冬夜。

sentences.english: Building facades pulsate with millions of lights and glowing neon display.
sentences.chinese: 在千萬燈光和霓虹燈的照耀下。

sentences.english: Omnia sol temperat The sun warms everything.
The stars shone brighter than ever before, and an owl hooted in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 星星照耀得比以往更加明亮，貓頭鷹在遠處咕咕叫着。

sentences.english: The brilliant shine dazzling me, I will be the dawn of the star.
sentences.chinese: 耀眼的光輝照耀着我，我將會成爲拂曉之星。

sentences.english: When the sun shines and there are no clouds, the sky is clear . �
sentences.chinese: 當太陽照耀而且無雲時，天空是晴朗的。

sentences.english: The sun has been shining on us since life began.
sentences.chinese: 自從生命之初，陽光就一直照耀着我們。

sentences.english: The sun, actually in Scorpio, was shining across into Taurus.
sentences.chinese: 其實在天蠍宮的太陽，照耀着金牛宮。

sentences.english: I saw the sun out of a clear azure sky.
sentences.chinese: 我看見太陽照耀在清朗的天空中。

sentences.english: The sun was shining in just the right way to illuminate the gills underneath.
sentences.chinese: 太陽正照耀着並恰好照亮了在下面的菌褶。

definition: (of the sunlight) to bathe all things/to shine gloriously
to set off by contrast/antithesis/analogy parallelism (linguistics)
to shine on/to light up/to irradiate
to dazzle/to brighten up (a room etc)
